title: Prerequisites for the Revolution and the State of the Russian Empire
description: Social, economic, and political crises in the Russian Empire on the eve of 1917. The impact of the First World War. Ukrainian national movement before the revolution.

title: The February Revolution and the Overthrow of Tsarism
description: Events of the February Revolution of 1917 in Petrograd. Abdication of Nicholas II. Formation of the Provisional Government. The impact of these events on Ukrainian lands.

title: Formation of the Ukrainian Central Rada
description: The establishment of the Central Rada in Kyiv, its first actions and ideology. The main figures: Hrushevsky, Vynnychenko, Petliura. Formation of autonomist aspirations.

title: First steps towards Ukraine's autonomy
description: The history of the creation of the First Universal. The reaction of the Provisional Government. Growth of Ukrainian self-awareness and formation of political demands for autonomy.
